title: Short-Intensive Course for Strengthening Language Teachers' Competencies in Human Rights and Democracy

context.prior_knowledge: Basic human rights concepts, educational experience, and foundational language education competencies (reading, writing, speaking)
context.additional_context: A course for pre-service/in-service teachers to enhance human rights sensitivity and analyze classroom application cases. Emphasizes human rights issue approaches within language education contexts—integrating human rights education through text analysis, vocabulary expansion, and expressive activities.

learning_goals: Analyze principles of human rights protection in wartime and present three applicable case studies for educational settings using language lesson text materials
Evaluate issues related to undocumented immigrants’ and refugees’ rights and design language education integration plans based on multicultural text analysis
Critically review global issues for women’s rights expansion, reflect them in language lesson activity design, and develop writing/discussion assignments

resources: Web Resources on International Human Rights Law
Summary of UN Human Rights Reports

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
